What error message? Can you start Firefox in safe mode? http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

comments.author: fmdevelopertim@gmail.com
comments.text: What error message? Can you start Firefox in safe mode? http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

comments.raw_text:
NO !!  To use the safe mode Firefox has to be opened,I CAN NOT open firefox. I already commented on the error message in an email I wont do that again. This all started when I downloaded your new Firefox which I guess is 4.0. (In reply to comment #1)

comments.raw_text: Check the note in that page under "How to start in safe mode", it will explain how to use safe mode without having to open Firefox (by holding down shift key while launching it).
comments.creator: mak@mozilla.com
comments.text: Check the note in that page under "How to start in safe mode", it will explain how to use safe mode without having to open Firefox (by holding down shift key while launching it).
comments.author: mak@mozilla.com

comments.text:
Yes  I saw that and tried it, using the shift key did not work. I even tried it again it still did not work. I even tried uninstalling the Firefox and reinstalling it. (In reply to comment #3)

comments.creator: mak@mozilla.com
comments.author: mak@mozilla.com
comments.text:
When you did that, did you ensure there was no firefox.exe process running in the task manager?
On reinstall, did you make a clean install (thus uninstall, then delete program files/mozilla firefox folder, then install)?

Don't you remember anything about waht the error message was saying?
At this point, if nothing worked, I'd try making a new profile: http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing profiles

comments.raw_text: Closing bug as WFM - if you are still experiencing this issue or have more information to provide feel free to post back here and we can re-open the bug. You can also get assistance by visiting the Firefox help site -> http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Ask+a+question
